# ExecutorJob.LocalAllocator

**Structure**

A job-local stack-disciplined allocator.

## Declaration

```swift
struct LocalAllocator
```

## Overview

This can be used to allocate additional data required by an executor implementation; memory allocated in this manner will be released automatically when the job is disposed of by the runtime.

N.B. Because this allocator is stack disciplined, explicitly deallocating memory out-of-order will cause your program to abort.

## Instance Methods

- **allocate(as:)**: Allocate uninitialized memory for a single instance of type `T`.
- **allocate(capacity:)**: Allocate a specified number of bytes of uninitialized memory.
- **allocate(capacity:as:)**: Allocate uninitialized memory for the specified number of instances of type `T`.
- **deallocate(_:)**: Deallocate previously allocated memory.  Note that the task allocator is stack disciplined, so if you deallocate a block of memory, all memory allocated after that block is also deallocated.
- **deallocate(_:)**: Deallocate previously allocated memory.  Note that the task allocator is stack disciplined, so if you deallocate a block of memory, all memory allocated after that block is also deallocated.
- **deallocate(_:)**: Deallocate previously allocated memory.  Note that the task allocator is stack disciplined, so if you deallocate a block of memory, all memory allocated after that block is also deallocated.
